### rpmalloc&#95;dump&#95;statistics() {#a3c33a5925ba558f8dc534c668e344db1}

<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  a very small overhead due to some size calculations not being compile time</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  constants</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#ifndef RPMALLOC&#95;CONFIGURABLE</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57" lineLink="#a6dccadaf86473444d85530d361d4109d"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define RPMALLOC&#95;CONFIGURABLE 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#endif</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">//! Define RPMALLOC&#95;FIRST&#95;CLASS&#95;HEAPS to enable heap based API (rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">//! functions).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  Will introduce a very small overhead to track fully allocated spans in heaps</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#ifndef RPMALLOC&#95;FIRST&#95;CLASS&#95;HEAPS</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64" lineLink="#aa20456aea27df9da3c00efecb1dba3b4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define RPMALLOC&#95;FIRST&#95;CLASS&#95;HEAPS 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#endif</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">//! Flag to rpaligned&#95;realloc to not preserve content in reallocation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68" lineLink="#affda05352198b9ef86d42be851a1349f"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define RPMALLOC&#95;NO&#95;PRESERVE 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">//! Flag to rpaligned&#95;realloc to fail and return null pointer if grow cannot be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">//! done in-place,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  in which case the original pointer is still valid (just like a call to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  realloc which failes to allocate a new block).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73" lineLink="#ab3774a093749aeca1d4e387b11e79395"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define RPMALLOC&#95;GROW&#95;OR&#95;FAIL 2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-thread-statistics-t/#a71dbb0253f1cf6f25837445b0d1edaf9"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-thread-statistics-t/#a71dbb0253f1cf6f25837445b0d1edaf9">size&#95;use</a>&#91;128&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154" lineLink="#aaef706ac2be95d5a4f00bfab78128234"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125; <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-thread-statistics-t">rpmalloc&#95;thread&#95;statistics&#95;t</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typedef</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t">rpmalloc&#95;config&#95;t</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! Map memory pages for the given number of bytes. The returned address MUST</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  aligned to the rpmalloc span size, which will always be a power of two.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  Optionally the function can store an alignment offset in the offset</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  variable in case it performs alignment and the returned pointer is offset</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  from the actual start of the memory region due to this alignment. The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  alignment offset will be passed to the memory unmap function. The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  alignment offset MUST NOT be larger than 65535 (storable in an uint16&#95;t),</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  if it is you must use natural alignment to shift it into 16 bits. If you</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  set a memory&#95;map function, you must also set a memory&#95;unmap function or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  else the default implementation will be used for both. This function must</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  be thread safe, it can be called by multiple threads simultaneously.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#adbcdb0bb951b75755ad9f6fa95c5fb89"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;(&#42;memory&#95;map)(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;offset);</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! Unmap the memory pages starting at address and spanning the given number</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! of bytes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  If release is set to non-zero, the unmap is for an entire span range as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  returned by a previous call to memory&#95;map and that the entire range should</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  be released. The release argument holds the size of the entire span range.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  If release is set to 0, the unmap is a partial decommit of a subset of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  mapped memory range. If you set a memory&#95;unmap function, you must also set</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  a memory&#95;map function or else the default implementation will be used for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  both. This function must be thread safe, it can be called by multiple</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  threads simultaneously.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a10fb22a2f8775aafd70b1c79f6b80630"><Highlight kind="normal">  void (&#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a10fb22a2f8775aafd70b1c79f6b80630">memory&#95;unmap</a>)(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;address, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> offset,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="normal">                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> release);</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! Called when an assert fails, if asserts are enabled. Will use the standard</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! assert()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  if this is not set.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a4bc0e407dff5707e6e199ba21f7afbc6"><Highlight kind="normal">  void (&#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a4bc0e407dff5707e6e199ba21f7afbc6">error&#95;callback</a>)(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;message);</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! Called when a call to map memory pages fails (out of memory). If this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! callback is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  not set or returns zero the library will return a null pointer in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  allocation call. If this callback returns non-zero the map call will be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  retried. The argument passed is the number of bytes that was requested in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  the map call. Only used if the default system memory map function is used</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  (memory&#95;map callback is not set).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a35106c441d799201ae0c57068d539ca4"><Highlight kind="normal">  int (&#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a35106c441d799201ae0c57068d539ca4">map&#95;fail&#95;callback</a>)(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>);</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! Size of memory pages. The page size MUST be a power of two. All memory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! mapping</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  requests to memory&#95;map will be made with size set to a multiple of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  page size. Used if RPMALLOC&#95;CONFIGURABLE is defined to 1, otherwise system</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  page size is used.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#adcf8dfc992b8b4a4e6cd72e213bf1035"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#adcf8dfc992b8b4a4e6cd72e213bf1035">page&#95;size</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! Size of a span of memory blocks. MUST be a power of two, and in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! &#91;4096,262144&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  range (unless 0 - set to 0 to use the default span size). Used if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  RPMALLOC&#95;CONFIGURABLE is defined to 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#ab730f9de6da78affe64497f859d6d345"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#ab730f9de6da78affe64497f859d6d345">span&#95;size</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! Number of spans to map at each request to map new virtual memory blocks.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! This can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  be used to minimize the system call overhead at the cost of virtual memory</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  address space. The extra mapped pages will not be written until actually</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  used, so physical committed memory should not be affected in the default</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  implementation. Will be aligned to a multiple of spans that match memory</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  page size in case of huge pages.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a84cfc60f2a133ca255a762778cc024c6"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a84cfc60f2a133ca255a762778cc024c6">span&#95;map&#95;count</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! Enable use of large/huge pages. If this flag is set to non-zero and page</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! size is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  zero, the allocator will try to enable huge pages and auto detect the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  configuration. If this is set to non-zero and page&#95;size is also non-zero,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  the allocator will assume huge pages have been configured and enabled</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  prior to initializing the allocator. For Windows, see</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/memory/large-page-support</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  For Linux, see https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/vm/hugetlbpage.txt</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a9cfb1a2f571e8ebe68185b387f04260b"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a9cfb1a2f571e8ebe68185b387f04260b">enable&#95;huge&#95;pages</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="comment">  //! Respectively allocated pages and huge allocated pages names for systems</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  supporting it to be able to distinguish among anonymous regions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="comment">//! Heap type</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typedef</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/heap-t">heap&#95;t</a> rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;t;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="comment">//! Acquire a new heap. Will reuse existing released heaps or allocate memory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="comment">//! for a new heap</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  if none available. Heap API is implemented with the strict assumption that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  only one single thread will call heap functions for a given heap at any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  given time, no functions are thread safe.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#a2d18f870b8bad81e931c8c0a01e3672b">RPMALLOC&#95;EXPORT</a> rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;t &#42;rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;acquire(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="comment">//! Release a heap (does NOT free the memory allocated by the heap, use</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="comment">//! rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;free&#95;all before destroying the heap).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  Releasing a heap will enable it to be reused by other threads. Safe to pass</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  a null pointer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#a2d18f870b8bad81e931c8c0a01e3672b">RPMALLOC&#95;EXPORT</a> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;release(rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;t &#42;heap);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="comment">//! Allocate a memory block of at least the given size using the given heap.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#a2d18f870b8bad81e931c8c0a01e3672b">RPMALLOC&#95;EXPORT</a> <a href="#a85561f3ac6a729bf480cdf706d6c75dc">RPMALLOC&#95;ALLOCATOR</a> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="normal">rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;alloc(rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;t &#42;heap, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>) <a href="#aaec208006a1707aadcfb577cd0e05014">RPMALLOC&#95;ATTRIB&#95;MALLOC</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="#aa78a4db7a8c062ad908eb3756e88cc8a">RPMALLOC&#95;ATTRIB&#95;ALLOC&#95;SIZE</a>(2);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="comment">//! Allocate a memory block of at least the given size using the given heap. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="comment">//! returned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  block will have the requested alignment. Alignment must be a power of two</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  and a multiple of sizeof(void&#42;), and should ideally be less than memory page</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  size. A caveat of rpmalloc internals is that this must also be strictly less</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  than the span size (default 64KiB).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
